title: 1356-A3
statement: A3. Distinguish Z from Stime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou are given an operation that implements a single-qubit unitary transformation: either the Z gate or the S gate. The operation will have Adjoint and Controlled variants defined.Your task is to perform necessary operations and measurements to figure out which unitary it was and to return 0 if it was the Z gate or 1 if it was the S gate.You are allowed to apply the given operation and its adjoint/controlled variants exactlytwice.You have to implement an operation which takes a single-qubit operation as an input and returns an integer. Your code should have the following signature:namespace Solution {open Microsoft.Quantum.Intrinsic;operation Solve (unitary : (Qubit => Unit is Adj+Ctl)) : Int {// your code here}}

processed.result:
You are given a function that applies a quantum operation to a single qubit. This operation can be either the Z gate or the S gate, and you are also given the adjoint and controlled versions of these gates.

Your task is to figure out which gate was applied using only two applications of the given gate and its variants (adjoint and controlled).  

You need to write a program that takes the gate function as input and outputs 0 if the gate was Z, and 1 if the gate was S.

You are given a special operation that can be applied to a single unit of data. You can apply this operation, its inverse, and a controlled version of it twice. Your goal is to figure out what type of operation it is and return a number (0 or 1) based on the type.
